# addConstraint(_:)

**Instance Method**

Adds the specified constraint to the layer.

## Declaration

```swift
func addConstraint(_ c: CAConstraint)
```

## Parameters

- **c**: The constraint object to add to the receiver’s array of constraint objects.

## Discussion

In macOS, you typically add constraints to a layer to manage the size and position of that layer’s sublayers. Before constraints can be applied, you must also assign a [doc://com.apple.quartzcore/documentation/QuartzCore/CAConstraintLayoutManager] object to the [doc://com.apple.quartzcore/documentation/QuartzCore/CALayer/layoutManager] property of the layer. For more information about managing layer-based constraints, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/CoreAnimation_guide/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40004514].

iOS apps do not support layer-based constraints.

## Managing layer constraints

- **constraints**: The constraints used to position current layer’s sublayers.
